alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 9:06PM CDT until March 31 at 9:06AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant affecting Montgomery and Elmore Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Alabama... Tallapoosa River At Wadley affecting Randolph, Tallapoosa and Chambers Counties. .The Tallapoosa River at the Tallapoosa River Water Plant will crest tonight, while the Tallapoosa River at Wadley has fallen below flood stage. Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tallapoosa River At The Tallapoosa Water Plant. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Low areas near the junction with the Coosa River begin to overflow. Extensive flooding of low lying areas begins between US 231 and the river at stages of 15 to 25 feet. At 25.0 feet, Extensive flooding of lowland areas begins west of the river and north of Anderson Road between stages of 25 to 30 feet. Any livestock and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. At 25.5 feet, Dozier Road on the Montgomery County side is closed due to water over the roadway. At 31.0 feet, Lower deck of water plant intake structure begins to flood. At 32.0 feet, Some residences off Lower Wetumpka Road in the Flatwood Community are subject to flooding as water rises between 32 and 36 feet. At 33.0 feet, Property around Red Eagle Honor Farm floods. At 34.0 feet, Evacuations become necessary at Red Eagle Farm as water rises to this stage and higher. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 34.3 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
